issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
When IÂ´m trying to get the camera permissions on iOS app runing 8.3.0.GA Ti.Media.cameraPermissions() shows me this error:

Ti.Media.hasCameraPermissions is not a function. (In 'Ti.Media.hasCameraPermissions()', 'Ti.Media.hasCameraPermissions' is undefined
fields.summary: Ti.Media.hasCameraPermissions() is not a function on 8.3.0.GA

comments.body:
Hello [~frodfigu],

Thanks for reaching to us. Seems it's maybe your coding issue. Can you please share a sample test code to reproduce the issue on our end?

Thanks

I had this happen after adding the hasCameraPermissions check without rebuilding the app (ie using liveview).
Build a basic example app with liveview enabled, then add the Ti.Media.hasCameraPermissions() check and it will throw the error above.
